Articles.Content: Hi, (sorry if this is the wrong forum) I was wondering if anyone has a table of Kerbin's atmospheric pressure curve. I'm asking because I have the 1/10 size Real Solar System config file, but the atmosphere still extends to 130 km. (It's not a bug, the person who made the config decided to keep it that way.) I would like to make Earth's atmosphere 70 km high like stock KSP.

Cryzrndm: please read *all* the post before responding. :]

livefree75: The table will be in the RealSolarSystem.cfg file--find the Kerbin {} node, and inside it find the pressureCurve. However, some pretty complex mathing by eggrobin was used to make that curve, to match the real atmosphere's behavior.

Cryzrndm: please read *all* the post before responding. :]

Somehow it took me reading that 3 times to notice the one word I missed >.<

livefree75: The table will be in the RealSolarSystem.cfg file--find the Kerbin {} node, and inside it find the pressureCurve. However, some pretty complex mathing by eggrobin was used to make that curve, to match the real atmosphere's behavior.

Could you scale the height key by 70/130? Depends on how those tangents are used I guess...

Yeah, I really oughtn't be one to cast stones about missing words, done it too much myself. Sorry.

Alas that would screw the tangents. I *think* you can just multiply all the tangents by 70/130 and it should come out ok, but don't quote me.
